section.title: Apache Forrest - org.apache.forrest.plugin.input.Lenya Plugin
section.p: This plugin retrieves documents from a Lenya repository.

section.title: Usage
section.p: Perhaps the most important thing to realise about this plugin is that there is no relationship between the Forrest URL space and the URL space defined in the Lenya repository. That is the path to and the name of each document within Forrest needs not be the same as the path to and the name of the document within the Lenya repository.

This enables the repository to be structured in a way that is appropriate for it's editors and the Forrest document collection can be structured in a way that is appropriate for the target audience. In fact, it is possible to use the same document from a Lenya repository in multiple Forrest collections each using a completely different URL space that is custom designed for the end user of the document collection.

section.title: Locationmap
section.p: In order to tell Forrest which document to retrieve from the repository you need to make use of the locationmap in Forrest. Your project must therefore provide a locationmap similar to the one that follows.
section.source:
<locationmap xmlns="http://apache.org/forrest/locationmap/1.0">
<components> <matchers default="lm"> <matcher name="lm" src="org.apache.forrest.locationmap.WildcardLocationMapHintMatcher"/> </matchers> </components>
<locator>
<match pattern="index.xml"> <location src="http://127.0.0.1:18888/default/live/index.xml" /> </match> <match pattern="lenya-site.xml"> <location src="cocoon://lenya-site.xml"/> </match> <match pattern="lenya/**.xml"> <location src="http://127.0.0.1:18888/default/live/{1}.xml"/> </match>
</locator> </locationmap>
section.p: The first match (pattern="index.xml") will redirect the request for index.xml to a named document in the Lenya repository. If you provide your index.xml file locally then omit this matcher.
section.note: In a future version of Forrest it planned to allow plugins to provide locationmaps of their own. Therefore, the need for a project to provide this locationmap will be removed.

section.title: Retrieveing Lenya Documents
section.p: To retrieve a lenya document simply request http://localhost:8888/lenya/PATH/TO/FILE.html.
section.note: It is intended that his need to fix the urlspace as lenya/** will be removed in a future version of the plugin
